Thanks Jean-Baptiste.

As a side thought, reading about novelty search once again reminds me
of tabu search - it seems to me that these novelty and diversification
metrics can be thougth of as tabu search in the behaviour space rather
than the encoding space. This thought then leads me into wondering if
we could speciate based on position in the behaviour space. There's
one good reason for not doing that which is that it would probably
make sexual reproduction within a species less effective, but then we
know we can run NEAT with just asexual reproduction.

It seems to me that there may be a continnum of NEAT search variants
on the axes:

pure objective fitness  <--> pure novelty fitness
encoding space speciation <--> behavior space speciation

Just a random thought.

Colin
